New Records: Shohei Ohtani recently became the first player in major league history with 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Shohei Ohtani reached 400 total bases, becoming the first player to do so since 2001.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers scored five runs in the seventh inning to secure a 7-2 win over the Padres.
Will Smith hit a tying, two-run homer off Joe Musgrove to start the Dodgers’ rally.
Shohei Ohtani went 3 for 5, driving in a go-ahead run and scoring another.
Pages added a two-run, two-strike, two-out homer in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani expressed his excitement about clinching the division and heading to the postseason for the first time in his career.
Manager Dave Roberts praised Shohei Ohtani's remarkable performance throughout the season.
General manager Brandon Gomes described the clubhouse celebration as 'total chaos' and emphasized that it never gets old.
Freddie Freeman's injury was noted as he was on crutches and in a walking boot after the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers clinched the National League West division title with the win.
A sellout crowd of 52,433, including retired Dodgers star Manny Ramirez, packed Dodger Stadium.
The Dodgers earned their 41st comeback victory of the season, tops in the National League.
The Dodgers improved to 95-64 and will open the playoffs on Oct. 5 at home in a best-of-five Division Series.
The Dodgers had not clinched at home since the pandemic-shortened 2020 season.
